required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Active Older Adult Program on Health and Well-being
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of an Active Older Adult Program at the Dan Abraham Healthy Living Center on Health and Well-being

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a structured 12-week program designed for older adults will improve physical function and, in parallel, circulating biomarkers of aging

primary_outcome.measure: Change in repeated chair rise time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study, approximately 14 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Chair stand test where participants will perform a chair rise movement for five repetitions. The series of 5 repetitions will be timed and measured in seconds.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma protein levels reflective of biological age
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be obtained at baseline and at 12 weeks. The concentration of target proteins (pg/mL) in the plasma will be measured and compared between baseline and week 12.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in expression of senescence-related genes in blood cells
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be obtained at baseline and at 12 weeks. The expression of senescence-related genes (arbitrary units) will be measured in immune cells isolated from whole blood and compared between baseline and week 12.

secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the Physical Component Scale (PCS) from the 12-Item short form general health survey (SF-12).
Measured using the timed up-and-go test (seconds to complete).
Measured using the Mental Component Scale (MCS) from the 12-Item short form general health survey (SF-12)

Measured using a linear analogue self-assessment scale of well-being from 0 ("as bad as it can be") to 10 ("as good as it can be") of mental, physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being, level of social activity, and overall quality of life during the past week

study_pop.textblock: The target population consists of The Dan Abraham Healthy Living Center (DAHLC) members 60 years of age and older who plan to participate in the Active Older Adult Program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women age 55 years or older.
- Membership at the DAHLC.
- New to AOA (Active Older Adult) Program and commitment to full participation in the twelve-week program.
- Must be able to get down and off the floor with little assistance.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent.
- Previous participation in the AOA Program at the DAHLC.
